nodejs.title: Node.js
nodejs.description: An open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment. Node.js helps developers write server-side scripting using JavaScript. It is asynchronous and event-driven.

npm.title: npm
npm.description: Node Package Manager is core of development system for Node.js. NPM consists of a command line and a database of packages. NPM also manages the packages that are both local project and public JavaScript tools.

express.title: Express.js
express.description: A free, open-source web application framework for Node.js. It is designed to build web applications and APIs. It is fast, unopinionated, and minimalist web framework.

nodemon.title: nodemon
nodemon.description: A tool that helps develop node.js based applications by automatically restarting the node application. Nodemon will monitor for any changes in source and automatically restart the server.

jquery.title: jQuery
jquery.description: A JavaScript library designed to simplify HTML DOM manipulation, including event handling, css animation, and Ajax. It is free, open-source software.

restapi.title: REST API
restapi.description: Representational State Transfer is a software architectural style that defines a set of constraints that can be used to create web services. RESTful Web services allow the requesting systems to access and manipulate textual representations of Web resources by using a uniform and predefined set of stateless operations.

http_methods.title: HTTP methods
http_methods.description: GET method retrieves representation of the member resource. POST method creates a member resource. PUT method replaces the representation of member resource of the collection. DELETE method deletes representation of the member resource.
